# HIT Summer Course 2025

​          Artificial Intelligence and Machine  Learning  (14-17 July, 2025)  

 

​                            **Individual Assignment** 

 

**Part A (\*10 marks\*)**

Suppose you are going to drive from city Arad to Bucharest according to the map below. The distance between two cities is marked in the graph. The heuristic information is shown as the straight-lined distance between any city to the target city. Please answer the following questions:

 

 ![img](file:///C:/Users/14144/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image002.gif)  ![img](file:///C:/Users/14144/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image004.gif)

 

1) Use transition model to formulate the problem and write down the initial state, goal state, solution, and give one example of transition model. *(3 marks)* 

2) Find the solution using breadth-first search algorithm and write down each step. *(3 marks)*

3) Find the solution using A* search algorithm and write down each step. *(4 marks)*

 

 

**Part B (\*10 marks\*)**

Which of the following wffs (well-formed formula) are tautologies, which are contradictions, and which are neither? Please provide your answers with proper explanation. Be brief and concise.

 

 ![img](data:image/emf;base64,)

 

 

 

 

**Part C (\*10 marks\*)**

For the following dataset with binary classes (“yes” and “no”), please provide the detailed steps to build a decision tree by using ID3 algorithm. 

​          **![img](file:///C:/Users/14144/AppData/Local/Temp/msohtmlclip1/01/clip_image008.jpg)**

 

**Assessment criteria:**

·    Clear steps and correct solution
